alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Hanover, Pender, southeastern Bladen, Brunswick and southeastern Columbus Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Honey Island, or 13 miles north of Shallotte, moving northeast at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Oak Island, Carolina Beach, Burgaw, Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Wrightsville Beach, Kure Beach, Surf City, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Caswell Beach, Bald Head Island, Snows Cut, South Masonboro Island, Ocean Crest Pier, Figure Eight Island, Yaupon Beach and Rich Inlet. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 416. Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal Brunswick; Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
